sentence: It is my pleasure to meet virtually this evening with the members and invited guests of the Foreign Policy Association (FPA).1 I am truly honored to receive the Foreign Policy Association Medal.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Reserve. It focuses on a personal honor and a meeting with the Foreign Policy Association, which does not directly impact monetary policy decisions.

sentence: Past honorees have included Sheila Bair, Anne-Marie Slaughter, Paul Volcker, Jean-Claude Trichet, and my Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) colleague John Williamsâand so with this award, I am indeed in select company.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of the FOMC or its members.

sentence: Although I have been very much looking forward to receiving this award in person, that, of course, is not possible tonight, but I greatly look forward to attending a future dinner to convey in person my genuine appreciation to the members of the FPA for this special honor.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Reserve. It solely expresses the speaker's anticipation for attending a future dinner to express gratitude for receiving an award.

sentence: Since mid-March, I, along with my FOMC colleagues, have been working from home.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the working arrangements of the speaker and does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: Indeed, just last week, we held our scheduled June meeting via secure teleconference.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it only mentions the method of conducting the June meeting. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance, nor does it have any implications on monetary policy.

sentence:
And while I certainly miss the opportunities for face-to-face interactions along the corridors of the Board's Eccles Building, I am grateful to have the ability to work from home and want to convey my deep gratitude to all of those on the frontlines of the crisis, who are working outside the comfort of their homes in grocery stores, hospitals, and other businesses that provide essential services.Current Economic Situation and Outlook
While the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic has taken a tragic human toll measured in terms of lives lost and suffering inflicted, the pandemic has also inflicted a heavy toll on the levels of activity and employment in the U.S. economy, as a direct result of the necessary public health policies put in place to mitigate and control the spread of the virus.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the personal experiences and gratitude of the speaker rather than providing any information or implications related to the current economic situation and outlook.

sentence: Real gross domestic product (GDP) declined at a 5 percent annual rate in the first quarter of the year and will almost surely continue to contract at an unprecedented pace in the second quarter.
reason: This sentence suggests a significant contraction in the US economy, indicating a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The decline in GDP and the expectation of further contraction imply a need for expansionary measures to stimulate economic growth and stabilize the economy.

sentence: The unemployment rate, which reached a 50-year low of 3.5 percent as recently as February of this year, surged to 14.7 percent in April, an 80-year high.
reason: This sentence highlights the significant impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the US economy, leading to a sharp increase in the unemployment rate. Given the drastic change, it is irrelevant to assess its implications on US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the Federal Reserve's stance, whether hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: In May, there was a notable rebound in employment and decline in unemployment, and these developments are certainly welcome.
reason: This sentence suggests a positive outlook on the US economy, indicating a potential improvement in employment and a decrease in unemployment. It can be considered as a dovish statement, as it implies a favorable economic situation that may influence the Federal Reserve to maintain or adopt accommodative monetary policies.

sentence: Moreover, in recent weeks, some other indicators suggest a stabilization or even a modest rebound in some segments of the economy.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it acknowledges a potential stabilization or rebound in certain sectors of the economy. However, without further context, it remains irrelevant to determine whether the overall policy will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: But activity in many parts of the economy has yet to pick up, and GDP is falling deeply below its recent peak.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of activity not picking up and GDP falling below its recent peak indicates a weak economy, which may prompt policymakers to adopt accommodative measures to stimulate growth.

sentence: And, of course, despite the improvements seen in the May jobs report, the unemployment rate, at 13.3 percent, remains historically high.After the extreme turbulence witnessed in March, financial markets across many sectors have normalized and are again serving their essential role of intermediating flows of savings and investment among borrowers and lenders.
reason: This sentence suggests that despite the improvements in the May jobs report, the unemployment rate remains historically high. However, it also mentions that financial markets have normalized and are functioning properly. This information is neutral and does not provide a clear indication of the stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Bank credit lines are providing liquidity to companies, and corporations with debt rated investment grade and high yield are able to issue, and in size, in the corporate bond market.
reason: This sentence suggests that bank credit lines are supporting liquidity for companies, and both investment grade and high yield corporations can issue corporate bonds. This indicates a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it highlights the availability of funding options for different types of companies.

sentence: I believeâand most outside observers agreeâthat this easing of financial conditions since March is, at least in part, the direct consequence of economic policy responses to the crisis, including the actions the Federal Reserve took at our March 15 meeting and the subsequent announcement and sequential launch of 11 new facilities to support the flow of credit to households and companies.
reason: This sentence suggests that the easing of financial conditions since March is a result of the Federal Reserve's actions and policies. It implies a dovish stance as the Fed's measures have contributed to improving credit flow to households and companies, indicating a supportive approach towards the economy.

sentence: While this easing of financial conditions is, of course, welcome to the extent that it supports the flow of credit to households and firms during this challenging period, it may not prove to be durable, depending on the course that the coronavirus contagion takes and the duration of the recession that it causes.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges the positive impact of easing financial conditions on credit flow during the challenging period but also highlights the uncertainty of its durability due to the course of the coronavirus contagion and the recession's duration.

sentence: At minimum, the easing of financial conditions is buying some time until the economy begins to recover.As I speak to you today, there is extraordinary uncertainty about both the depth and the duration of the economic downturn.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The mention of easing financial conditions implies a dovish approach, indicating a willingness to support the economy. However, the uncertainty surrounding the economic downturn indicates a cautious or neutral stance, as the policymakers are unsure about the appropriate course of action.

sentence: Because the course of the economy will depend on the course of the virus and the public health policies put in place to mitigate and contain it, there is an unusually wide range of scenarios for the evolution of the economy that could plausibly play out over the next several years.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges the uncertainty surrounding the economy due to the virus and public health policies, indicating that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) may adopt a cautious and adaptable approach rather than leaning towards a hawkish or dovish stance.

sentence: In my baseline view, while I do believe it will likely take some time for economic activity and the labor market to fully recover from the pandemic shock, I do project right now that the economy will resume growth starting in the third quarter.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The speaker acknowledges the time needed for economic recovery but projects growth in the third quarter, indicating a cautious optimism. It does not provide a clear indication of a hawkish or dovish stance, making it irrelevant for immediate policy decisions.

sentence: In terms of inflation, my projection is for the COVID-19 contagion shock to be disinflationary, not inflationary, and the data we are seeing so far are consistent with this projection.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The projection indicates that the COVID-19 shock will lead to disinflation rather than inflation. The data observed align with this projection, implying a need for accommodative measures to stimulate the economy, making it relevant for monetary policy decisions.

sentence: For example, core CPI (consumer price inflation) prices fell 0.4 percent in April, the largest monthly decrease since the beginning of the series in 1957.
reason: This sentence is dovish as it indicates a significant decrease in core CPI prices, suggesting a potential deflationary pressure. This could influence the US monetary policy towards a more accommodative stance to stimulate economic growth and prevent further decline in prices.

sentence: Although the decline in core CPI was smaller in May, on a year-over-year basis, core CPI is running at 1.2 percent, the slowest pace in nine years.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish implication on US monetary policy. The mention of core CPI running at the slowest pace in nine years indicates a low inflation rate, which may prompt the Federal Reserve to adopt a more accommodative stance to stimulate economic growth.

sentence: While the COVID-19 shock is disrupting both aggregate demand and supply, the net effect, I believe, will be for aggregate demand to decline relative to aggregate supply, both in the near term and over the medium term.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of the COVID-19 shock disrupting both aggregate demand and supply implies a need for supportive measures. The expectation of aggregate demand declining relative to aggregate supply indicates a potential need for accommodative policies to stimulate economic growth.

sentence: If so, downward pressure on PCE (personal consumption expenditures) inflation, which was already running somewhat below our 2 percent objective when the downturn began in March, will continue.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It indicates concern about downward pressure on PCE inflation, which was already below the 2 percent objective. This implies a need for accommodative measures to stimulate inflation and support economic recovery.

sentence: Moreover, I judge that measures of longer-term inflation expectations were, when the downturn began, at the low end of a range that I consider consistent with our 2 percent inflation objective and, given the likely depth of this downturn, are at risk of falling below that range.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of longer-term inflation expectations being at the low end of the desired range and the risk of falling below it indicates a concern for potential deflationary pressures.

sentence: The Federal Reserve has a dual mandate from the Congress to pursue policies that aim to achieve and sustain maximum employment and price stability.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to the current US monetary policy as it simply states the Federal Reserve's dual mandate from Congress to pursue maximum employment and price stability, without indicating any specific stance or direction (hawkish, dovish, or neutral) towards monetary policy.

sentence:
To me, price stability requires that inflation expectations remain well anchored at our 2 percent objective, and I will place a high priority on advocating policies that will be directed at achieving not only maximum employment, but also well-anchored inflation expectations consistent with our 2 percent objective.The Policy Response
At the Federal Reserve, we take our dual-mandate obligations of maximum employment and price stability very seriously, and, since March 3, we have deployed our entire toolkit to provide critical support to the economy during this challenging time.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The speaker emphasizes the importance of price stability and advocates for policies that prioritize achieving maximum employment and well-anchored inflation expectations. The mention of deploying the entire toolkit to support the economy further indicates a dovish approach.

sentence: In two unscheduled meetings, we voted on March 3 and March 15 to cut the target range for the federal funds rate by a total of 150 basis points to its current range of 0 to 25 basis points.2 In our FOMC statements, we have indicated we expect to maintain the target range at this level until we are confident that the economy has weathered recent events and is on track to achieve our maximum-employment and price-stability goals.On March 16, we launched a program to purchase Treasury securities and agency mortgage-backed securities in whatever amounts needed to support smooth market functioning, thereby fostering effective transmission of monetary policy to broader financial conditions.
reason: This sentence indicates a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The unscheduled rate cuts and the commitment to maintain the target range at its current level until economic recovery suggests a proactive approach to stimulate the economy. Additionally, the launch of a program to purchase securities shows a commitment to ensuring smooth market functioning and transmission of monetary policy, further supporting a dovish stance.

sentence: To date, these purchases have totaled more than $2.3 trillion, and, as we indicated at our June meeting, they will continue in coming months at least at the current pace, which should sustain smooth market functioning, thereby fostering effective transmission of monetary policy to broader financial conditions.Since March 17, the Board has announced the establishment of no fewer than 11 new facilities to support the flow of credit to households and businesses.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of continuing purchases at the current pace and the establishment of new facilities to support credit flow indicate a commitment to maintaining accommodative measures to support the economy.

sentence: These programs are authorized under emergency lending powers granted to the Fed under section 13(3) of the Federal Reserve Act and are available only in "unusual and exigent" circumstances and with the consent of the Secretary of Treasury.3 These facilities are supported with money invested by the Department of the Treasury, drawing on appropriations of more than $450 billion authorized by the Congress in the CARES Act (Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act) for the specific purpose of investing in Fed programs to sustain the flow of credit to households, firms, and communities during the coronavirus pandemic.
reason: This sentence explains the authorization and funding of emergency lending programs by the Fed, supported by the Department of the Treasury, to sustain credit flow during the coronavirus pandemic. It is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the implementation of specific programs rather than indicating a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: With these facilities, we are providing a bridge by stepping in and supporting lending throughout the economy until the recovery takes hold.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The use of "providing a bridge" and "supporting lending" indicates a willingness to continue accommodative measures until the economy fully recovers, which aligns with a dovish approach.

sentence: These programs are designed to offer backstop sources of funding to the private sector, and just the announcement that these backstop facilities would soon be launched appears to have bolstered confidence in capital markets, allowing many companies to finance themselves privately even before the facilities were up and running.
reason: This sentence suggests that the announcement of backstop facilities has positively impacted confidence in capital markets, enabling companies to secure private financing. However, it does not directly address the stance of US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in determining whether it is hawkish, dovish, neutral, or irrelevant.

sentence: When that day comes and we are confident the economy is solidly on the road to recovery, we will wind down these lending facilities at such time as we determine the circumstances we confront are no longer unusual or exigent.The Federal Reserve has played a leading role in the global economic policy response to the coronavirus pandemic.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that the Federal Reserve will wind down lending facilities once the economy is confidently on the road to recovery and the circumstances are no longer unusual or exigent. The sentence does not provide any explicit indication of a hawkish, dovish, or irrelevant stance.

sentence: Foreign financial institutions borrow and lend in U.S. dollars, and these dollar funding markets seized up when COVID-19 emerged.
reason: This sentence implies that the COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the dollar funding markets, which is relevant to US monetary policy. It suggests a potential need for intervention to address the seized-up markets, indicating a dovish stance to ensure liquidity and stability in the financial system.

sentence: In globally integrated financial markets such as ours, these strains in dollar funding markets outside the United States affect the flow of credit to U.S. households and businesses.
reason: This sentence suggests that the strains in dollar funding markets outside the United States have an impact on the flow of credit to U.S. households and businesses. It is relevant to US monetary policy as it highlights the interconnectedness of global financial markets, which could influence the Federal Reserve's decision-making. However, it does not explicitly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: As such, during the week of March 15, the Federal Reserve coordinated with five foreign central banks to enhance its standing dollar liquidity swap lines.4 In addition, temporary swap lines were reestablished with the nine central banks that had temporary agreements during the Global Financial Crisis.5 Moreover, to support dollar liquidity to a broad range of countries, the Federal Reserve announced a new program on March 31, the temporary FIMA (Foreign and International Monetary Authorities) Repo Facility.
reason: This sentence indicates that the Federal Reserve took proactive measures to enhance dollar liquidity swap lines with foreign central banks, reestablished temporary swap lines with central banks from the Global Financial Crisis, and introduced a new program called the temporary FIMA Repo Facility. These actions suggest a neutral stance towards US monetary policy, as they aim to support dollar liquidity without explicitly leaning towards a hawkish or dovish approach.

sentence: Under this facility, FIMA account holders at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York (which include central banks and other monetary authorities) can enter into overnight repos (repurchase agreements) with the Federal Reserve, temporarily exchanging U.S. Treasury securities in their accounts for U.S. dollars, which can then be provided to institutions in their respective jurisdictions.
reason: This sentence describes a facility that allows FIMA account holders to enter into overnight repos with the Federal Reserve, exchanging Treasury securities for US dollars. This is a neutral statement as it does not indicate any specific stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: All of these facilities have had a very constructive effect in calming down dollar funding markets and supporting a return to more normal conditions in global financial markets more generally.Of course, as members of the FPA, you are well aware that developments in the U.S. economy do not happen in isolation from the rest of the world.
reason: This sentence suggests that the facilities implemented by the FOMC have been effective in stabilizing dollar funding markets and improving global financial conditions. It implies a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it acknowledges the interconnectedness of the US economy with the rest of the world.

sentence: We live in a globally integrated economy.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the stance or direction of the policy. It simply states a general fact about the global economy's integration, which does not directly impact the monetary policy's hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: With COVID-19, all countries have been hit by a global common shock, not only directly by the virus and the measures necessary to combat it, but also by the economic spillovers from those actions around the world.
reason: This sentence acknowledges the global impact of COVID-19 on all countries, including the US. However, it does not provide any specific implications for US monetary policy. Therefore, it is irrelevant to the assessment of US monetary policy stance.

sentence: My colleagues and I have worked closely with othersâbilaterally and in international forums like the Group of Seven, Group of Twenty, Bank for International Settlements, and Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Developmentâto monitor and address the effects of the pandemic.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the stance or direction of the policy. It simply highlights the collaborative efforts of the FOMC and other international organizations in monitoring and addressing the effects of the pandemic.

sentence: The forcefulness and synchronized timing of actions by fiscal authorities, central banks, and regulators have helped support the incomes of households and firms and reduce market stresses that could have amplified the shock.Not only is the Federal Reserve using its full range of tools to support the economy through this challenging time, but our policies will also help ensure that the rebound in activity when it commences will be as robust as possible.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It highlights the forcefulness and synchronized actions of fiscal authorities, central banks, and regulators in supporting households, firms, and reducing market stresses. It also emphasizes the Federal Reserve's commitment to using its full range of tools to support the economy and ensure a robust rebound in activity.

sentence: That said, it is important to note that the Fed's statutory authority grants us lending powers, not spending powers.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the Fed's authority on lending and spending powers, which does not directly impact the stance of monetary policy. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: The Fed is not authorized to grant money to particular beneficiaries, to meet the payroll expenses of small businesses, or to underwrite the unemployment benefits of displaced workers.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the limitations of the Fed's authority in granting money to specific beneficiaries, meeting payroll expenses, and underwriting unemployment benefits. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Programs to support such worthy goals reside squarely in the domain of fiscal policy.
reason: This sentence suggests that programs aimed at supporting worthy goals are the responsibility of fiscal policy, not monetary policy. Therefore, it is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Direct fiscal support for the economy is thus also essential to sustain economic activity and complement what monetary policy cannot accomplish on its own.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It emphasizes the need for direct fiscal support to sustain economic activity, implying that monetary policy alone is insufficient.

sentence: Direct fiscal support can make a critical difference, not just in helping families and businesses stay afloat in a time of need, but also in sustaining the productive capacity of the economy after we emerge from this downturn.Fortunately, the fiscal policy response in the United States to the coronavirus shock has been both robust and timely.
reason: This sentence suggests that direct fiscal support plays a crucial role in supporting families, businesses, and the economy during and after the downturn. It implies a positive outlook on the fiscal policy response in the United States, indicating a dovish stance towards US monetary policy.

sentence: In four pieces of legislation passed in just over two months, the Congress voted $2.9 trillion in coronavirus relief, about 14 percent of GDP.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the Congress passing legislation for coronavirus relief, which does not directly impact the monetary policy stance of the Federal Reserve.

sentence:
Depending on the course of the virus and the course of the economy, more support from both fiscal and monetary policy may be called for.Concluding Remarks
The coronavirus pandemic poses the most serious threat to maximum employment and, potentially, to price stability that the United States has faced in our lifetimes.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC is acknowledging the potential need for additional support from both fiscal and monetary policy in response to the course of the virus and the economy. It implies a neutral stance, as it does not explicitly lean towards a hawkish or dovish approach.

sentence: There is much that policymakersâand epidemiologistsâsimply do not know right now about the potential course that the virus, and thus the economy, will take.
reason: This sentence implies a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges the uncertainty surrounding the virus and its impact on the economy, indicating that policymakers are cautious and may adopt a wait-and-see approach rather than taking immediate hawkish or dovish actions.

sentence: But there is one thing that I am certain about: The Federal Reserve will continue to act forcefully, proactively, and aggressively as we deploy our toolkitâincluding our balance sheet, forward guidance, and lending facilitiesâto provide critical support to the economy during this challenging time and to do all we can to make sure that the recovery from this downturn, once it commences, is as robust as possible.1.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The Federal Reserve is committed to using various tools, such as balance sheet, forward guidance, and lending facilities, to provide strong support to the economy during challenging times and ensure a robust recovery from the downturn.

sentence: These remarks represent my own views, which do not necessarily represent those of the Federal Reserve Board or the Federal Open Market Committee.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it clarifies that the remarks expressed are personal opinions and not reflective of the official stance of the Federal Reserve Board or the Federal Open Market Committee.

sentence: I am grateful to Brian Doyle and Chiara Scotti of the Federal Reserve Board staff for their assistance in preparing this text.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it expresses gratitude towards individuals who assisted in preparing the text, without providing any indication of the stance (hawkish, dovish, or neutral) or implications on monetary policy.

sentence: See the FOMC statements issued after the March 3 and March 15 FOMC meetings, which are available (along with other postmeeting statements) on the Board's website at https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomccalendars.htm.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it only provides information on where to find the FOMC statements issued after the March 3 and March 15 meetings, without indicating any hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: See Federal Reserve Act, 12 U.S.C.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it simply refers to the Federal Reserve Act, which is the legislation that established the Federal Reserve System. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: The swap fee was reduced from 50 basis points to 25 basis points over the U.S. dollar overnight index swap rate.
reason: This sentence implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy as the reduction in the swap fee indicates a move towards easing measures, potentially aimed at stimulating economic activity and liquidity in the market.

sentence: To better target stresses in funding markets for longer-term dollar borrowing, swap operations with a maturity of 84 days were added to the usual 7-day operations by the four central banks that traditionally hold regular auctionsâthe Bank of England, the Bank of Japan, the European Central Bank, and the Swiss National Bank.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses swap operations conducted by central banks other than the Federal Reserve. Therefore, it does not provide any implications on the US monetary policy stance, whether hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: Finally, these four central banks announced that they would begin daily auctions.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information about the stance of the central banks towards interest rates or their intentions regarding monetary policy.

sentence: See Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (2020), "Coordinated Central Bank Action to Enhance the Provision of U.S. Dollar Liquidity," press release, March 15; and Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (2020), "Coordinated Central Bank Action to Further Enhance the Provision of U.S. Dollar Liquidity," press release, March 20.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it refers to press releases regarding coordinated central bank actions to enhance the provision of U.S. Dollar liquidity. It does not provide any information or implications on whether the policy stance is hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: See Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (2020), "Federal Reserve Announces the Establishment of Temporary U.S. Dollar Liquidity Arrangements with Other Central Banks," press release, March 19.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it refers to the establishment of temporary U.S. Dollar liquidity arrangements with other central banks, which does not directly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.
